intro: Mammillaria saboae subsp. roczekii, commonly known as the Roček's mammillaria, is a small cactus native to Mexico. It features a globular or cylindrical stem with prominent tubercles and radial spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water. Its compact size and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and cactus collections.
